sourceDesc.p: Text from Report of the Speeches of the Glasgow Athenaeum Soirée, 28 Jan 1851

body.p: I should have answered your note sooner had I not been visiting in the country.CD returned to London on 16 Jan from Rockingham Castle, where he had been since 7 Jan. I am very sensible of the honour the Directors of the Glasgow AthenaeumFounded 1847. do me in inviting me to repeat a visitCD had presided at the first soirée of the Glasgow Athenaeum on 28 Dec 47: see Pilgrim Letters 5, p. 216n and Speeches of CD, ed. K. J. Fielding, pp. 85-92. of which I entertain the pleasantest remembrances. But, I regret to add that engagements render it quite out of my power to support the distinguished president on the occasion of the second triennial soiree.After the success of the first grand soirée, it was intended to arrange one triennially (James Lauder, The Glasgow Athenaeum, A Sketch of Fifty Years’ Work (1847-97), 1897, p. 38): the next, after 1851, was in Dec 55. I beg to present my tribute of respect to his Grace,George Douglas Campbell, Duke of Argyll (1823-1900; Dictionary of National Biography). Succeeded to the dukedom in 1847. He presided at the second soirée, 28 Jan 51. and to the directors and members, and remain, dear Sir,
